data.title: Service Award Recipients
data.text:
Staff Assembly Service Awards

Staff members who have reached milestones in their service with the University of California are recognized at our quarterly general meetings held at HUB 302. The awards, which are presented in five-year increments, are presented through a partnership between Staff Assembly and the Office of the Chancellor.

Recipients who attend the general meeting are presented with a certificate and the opportunity to have a photo taken with the chancellor or other senior leadership. Individuals unable to attend the general meeting will receive their certificate via email.

Receiving Your Award

You should receive an email notifying you that have reached a career milestone and inviting you to attend the upcoming meeting. You will be asked to RSVP in advance and to check in at HUB 302 on the day of the meeting. The schedule for upcoming meetings is available here.

The list of service milestones is provided to Staff Assembly from UCR Human Resources at the beginning of the fiscal year. Any questions, corrections or omissions should first be handled through the staff members local payroll/human resources representative, then UCR Human Resources and then Staff Assembly. Please note that service award pins are distributed through Human Resources, not Staff Assembly.

Milestones and Meeting Dates

If you are approaching a career milestone and expecting to receive a service award, please refer to the chart below to determine when you will be receiving it. The cutoff date is the 21st day of the last month for each quarter, as listed below. Career milestones reached after the 21st of that month will be grouped into the following quarter's recognition timeline.

Month Milestone Attained Service Award Presented July, August, September, October Fall Meeting November, December, January, February Winter Meeting March, April, May, June Spring Meeting

Click the tabs below to see the our lists of recipients for the current and previous academic years. Lists are sorted by years of service, then alphabetical order.
